project_manifesto.name: AI Resume Architect
project_manifesto.mission: To replace generic 'resume rewriters' with an intelligent 'Career Interviewer Agent' that extracts hidden value from candidates and tailors it perfectly to specific job descriptions.
project_manifesto.target_audience: Job seekers who have the skills but lack the ability to sell themselves in writing. Specifically targeting the Israeli and Global tech market.

business_model.pricing_strategy: Low barrier to entry (~$3-5 / 10-20 ILS per optimized resume).
business_model.rationale: Avoids subscription fatigue. Beats competitors like Teal/Resume.io who force monthly plans.

market_analysis.current_landscape: Red Ocean (Highly competitive). Flooded with basic ChatGPT wrappers and expensive subscription tools.
market_analysis.competitor_weakness: Most tools only 'rewrite' existing text. They do not 'extract' missing information.
market_analysis.our_unfair_advantage: The 'Interviewer' Logic. We don't just polish; we proactively ask questions to uncover achievements the user forgot to mention (e.g., 'Did you improve performance? By how much?').

core_features.name: The Job Analyzer
core_features.description: Extracts hard/soft skills, tone, and hidden requirements from the JD (Job Description) URL or text.

core_features.name: The Proactive Interviewer (Killer Feature)
core_features.description: Instead of asking 'What did you do?', the AI suggests plausible achievements based on the role. Example: 'As a React dev, did you optimize load times? usually, this results in a 20% boost. Is this true for you?'

core_features.name: Resume Synthesis
core_features.description: Rebuilds the resume using ATS-friendly formatting, injecting the extracted keywords and quantified achievements.

user_flow: Step 1: Landing Page -> User pastes Job Description URL + Uploads current Resume (PDF).
Step 2: Analysis (Spinner) -> AI identifies gaps between Candidate and Job.
Step 3: The Wizard (Chat) -> AI asks 3-5 sharp, high-value questions to bridge the gaps.
Step 4: Preview -> User sees a blurred/watermarked preview of the optimized resume.
Step 5: Payment -> User pays small fee.
Step 6: Download -> Get PDF + Editable Doc + Cover Letter.

stack.ui_library: Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui + Framer Motion (for smooth wizard transitions)
stack.database: Prisma (PostgreSQL/SQLite) - to store sessions and drafts
stack.ai_model: Claude 3.5 Sonnet (via API) - chosen for superior reasoning and coding capabilities
stack.file_processing: PDF Parsing Library (e.g., pdf-parse or specialized API) handled within n8n

n8n_workflow_structure.Route 1 - Ingestion: Receive PDF + JD -> Parse Text -> Vectorize/Analyze -> Return Initial Gaps.
n8n_workflow_structure.Route 2 - Interview: Receive User Answers -> Contextualize -> Generate Follow-up or Finalize.
n8n_workflow_structure.Route 3 - Generation: Compile Final Data -> Render PDF -> Return Download Link.

recruiter_agent.instruction: Identify the top 5 critical requirements. Ignore fluff. Find the 'pain point' of the hiring manager.

interviewer_agent.instruction: Do not be passive. Be suggestive. Look for numbers ($ saved, % improved, time reduced). Challenge the user to quantify their work.

writer_agent.instruction: Use active verbs. Mirror the JD's terminology exactly (for ATS). Format cleanly. No hallucinations.

implementation_roadmap.phase_1_mvp: Core flow: Upload -> simple chat (text based) -> Result text output. No payment, local DB.
implementation_roadmap.phase_2_ui: Implement the 'Wizard' UI with animations. Real PDF generation.
